d_crater.zhcn_desc: 某物体撞击了这颗星球的表面，形成了该巨大的撞击坑。
d_crater.en_desc: Something collided with the surface of this world at some point, creating this massive impact crater.

d_wandering_forests.zhcn_desc: 这个世界的迁徙森林频繁集体迁移到新的地区，破坏建设好的道路，输电线路和其他基础设施。
d_wandering_forests.en_desc: The mobile forests of this world frequently migrate en masse to new regions, disrupting efforts at building roads, power lines and other infrastructure.

d_sinkhole_subterraneans.zhcn_desc: 通往地下洞穴网络的巨大洞口，里面的洞穴纵横交错，贯通整个星球。
d_sinkhole_subterraneans.en_desc: A large hole in the ground that leads into the extensive cave network stretching beneath the surface of this world.

d_titanic_life_blocker.zhcn_desc: 许多巨型外星生物在这里安家，避开它们才是明智选择。
d_titanic_life_blocker.en_desc: Numerous Titanic aliens make this area their home, it would be wise to avoid it.

d_failing_infrastructure.zhcn_desc: 这片区域充斥着大量废弃的工业建筑与含有剧毒的土壤，都是旧时代的遗物。
d_failing_infrastructure.en_desc: This region is covered by ruined industrial complexes and toxic soil; detritus from a past age of progress.

d_decrepit_dwellings.zhcn_desc: 这片区域被大片贫民窟占据，里面住满了穷人与流浪者。
d_decrepit_dwellings.en_desc: This region is covered by vast shanty towns and slums filled with the poor and the outcast.

d_tomb_world_ruins.zhcn_desc: 这片废墟曾是座大城市，现在只有零星的拾荒者们在此苟且偷生。
d_tomb_world_ruins.en_desc: A scattered population of scavengers are eking out a desperate existence in the ruins of this once major city.

d_tomb_world_wasteland.zhcn_desc: 这片区域曾遭到大量核弹头袭击。尽管其辐射量与爆炸时相比已经减少了许多，但仍需要展开大规模清理才可居住。
d_tomb_world_wasteland.en_desc: A region that was the target of numerous nuclear warheads. Though the radiation in this area has gone down since the initial impact, it is still unfit for habitation barring a major clean-up effort.

d_machine_empire_ruins.zhcn_desc: 这座曾经的大城市已变为摇摇欲坠的废墟，原本的居民已消失得无影无踪。
d_machine_empire_ruins.en_desc: The crumbling remains of what must once have been a major population center on the planet. No traces of its past inhibitants remain.

d_exterminators_ruins.zhcn_desc: 这片焦黑并充满辐射的废墟曾经是一座有机生物的大都市。仍未倒下的那些建筑里现在也只剩下灰烬了。
d_exterminators_ruins.en_desc: The charred and irradiated ruins of what was once a major organic population center. Those buildings that still remain standing contain nothing but ashes now.

d_former_battlefield.zhcn_desc: 无数烧焦的战争机器，以及有机生物战士们的骸骨遍布于这片曾经的战场上。残余的辐射会对大部分电子设备造成干扰。
d_former_battlefield.en_desc: Tens of thousands of burnt warmachines and the twisted skeletal remains of organic soldiers litter the ground at this former battlefield. Residual pockets of radiation interferes with most electronics.

d_strip_mine.zhcn_desc: 这一区域在过去经历了高强度的露天开采，当时负责开采的原始陈旧机器未将该地区未来的发展纳入考虑范畴。
d_strip_mine.en_desc: This area was heavily strip mined in the past, by older and more primitive machine models that unfortunately were not programmed to take future development of the region into account.

d_unsupervised_settlement.zhcn_desc: 在这颗星球上，一小群有机生物社会仍存在于机械管理之外。暴力、疾病和饥荒在居住地的高墙内肆虐，其居民的科技水平已经倒退了数个世纪。
d_unsupervised_settlement.en_desc: A pocket of organic society on this world that still exists outside of machine supervision. Violence, disease and starvation runs rampant inside the settlement's walls, whose inhabitants have regressed technologically by several centuries.

d_collapsed_burrows.zhcn_desc: 这里曾经有着蜂巢居住的复杂地下隧道系统，但因对当地资源与野生动物的过度开发而被遗弃了。
d_collapsed_burrows.en_desc: This site once housed extensive underground tunnel systems inhabited by the Hive, but was abandoned due to overexploitation of local resources and wildlife.

d_assimilators_ruins.zhcn_desc: 那些选择自我终结而非被同化的有机生物的腐烂尸体充盈着这个曾经是主要定居点的破碎废墟。
d_assimilators_ruins.en_desc: This once major settlement is now a crumbling ruin, occupied only by the decaying bodies of those organics that chose self-termination rather than be assimilated.

d_fungoid_extermination.zhcn_desc: 这有毒粘液是真菌生物被消灭后仅剩的残留物。
d_fungoid_extermination.en_desc: This toxic goo is all that remains of the exterminated Fungoids.

d_egg_cracking.zhcn_desc: 地震现象使星球地壳开裂，喷出硫磺气体与毒性粘液。
d_egg_cracking.en_desc: Seismological phenomena are causing the planet crust to crack, spewing out sulfuric gases and toxic slime.

d_ruined_building_blocker.zhcn_desc: 大量废墟使这片区域无法通行。

d_ruined_arcology.zhcn_desc: 覆盖这颗城市星球的理想城已化为废墟。尽管其地基仍然坚实，许多腐朽的建筑结构仍需被清理才可进行重建。
d_ruined_arcology.en_desc: The Arcologies which cover this City-Planet lie in ruins. While the foundations are still solid, much of the decaying structure will need to be cleared before we can rebuild.

d_archaeological_site.zhcn_desc: 这块区域有着正在被发掘的古代考古学发现。
d_archaeological_site.en_desc: This area contains ancient archaeological finds that are being excavated.

d_metal_boneyard.zhcn_desc: 坍塌的建筑只剩下一副空空如也的金属架子，当风掠过，这空架子似乎发出了悲鸣声。
d_metal_boneyard.en_desc: The hollowed-out metal skeletons of fallen infrastructure seem almost to groan as the wind whistles through them.
d_metal_boneyard.zhcn_planet_modifier: 采矿区划最大建造数量：§G+4§!\n来自£job£ 岗位的£society_research£ 社会学研究：§G+10%§!

d_migrating_forests.zhcn_desc: 这个世界的迁徙森林频繁地迁移到新地区，给公路建设、电缆铺设等基建项目造成了极大干扰。

d_migrating_forests.zhcn_planet_modifier: 采矿区划最大建造数量：§R-1§!\n农业区划最大建造数量：§R-1§!\n发电区划最大建造数量：§R-1§!

d_migrating_forest_reserve.zhcn_desc: 这整个地区被隔离以供迁徙森林生长。它们可以在这里安全地生活，不用担心对城市造成任何破坏。
d_migrating_forest_reserve.en_desc: This entire region has been set aside for the migrating forests that are native to this world. Here they can roam in peace, without causing damage to urban areas.
d_migrating_forest_reserve.zhcn_planet_modifier: 来自£job£ 岗位的£society_research£ 社会学研究：§G+20%§!

d_junk_wastes.en_desc: The wastes stretch as far as one can see, with occasional pieces of larger junk jutting up out of the ground.
d_junk_wastes.zhcn_planet_modifier: 采矿区划最大建造数量：§G+3§!

d_junk_canals.zhcn_desc: 一道道狭窄的小溪串流在垃圾场中，导致局部土壤异常肥沃。
d_junk_canals.en_desc: These narrow canals snake around the junk piles, and some of the adjacent soil is surprisingly fertile.
d_junk_canals.zhcn_planet_modifier: 农业区划最大建造数量：§G+3§!

d_junk_hollows.zhcn_desc: 这些垃圾堆下的地底洞窟很适合用来建设反应堆。
d_junk_hollows.en_desc: These hollows deep beneath the surface junk would serve well as isolated reactor chambers.
d_junk_hollows.zhcn_planet_modifier: 发电区划最大建造数量：§G+3§!

d_irradiated_valley.zhcn_desc: 一场辐射量爆表的太阳耀斑横扫了这个偏僻的山谷。
d_irradiated_valley.en_desc: A solarflare has washed this isolated valley with heavy radiation.
d_irradiated_valley.zhcn_planet_modifier: 发电区划最大建造数量：§G+3§!

d_valley_of_zanaam.zhcn_desc: 这山谷之中矗立着十分神秘的石碑，上面刻满了已经不再流通的外星语言。靠近石碑时，能够感觉到充满能量波动的低鸣声，同时会感受到头痛。
d_valley_of_zanaam.en_desc: This valley is home to a mysterious obelisk that is covered in letters from a dead alien language. It hums with power and those in its proximity suffer headaches.
d_valley_of_zanaam.zhcn_planet_modifier: 来自£job£ 岗位的£society_research£ 社会学研究：§G+30%§!\n来自£job£ 岗位的£engineering_research£ 工程学研究：§G+30%§!\n来自£job£ 岗位的£physics_research£ 物理学研究：§G+30%§!

d_abandoned_primitive_homesteads.en_desc: These abandoned homesteads were once inhabited by a society of reptiles. They still populate the planet, but have since lost all capacity for sapient though.
d_abandoned_primitive_homesteads.zhcn_planet_modifier: 来自£job£ 岗位的£society_research£ 社会学研究：§G+10%§!\n农业区划最大建造数量：§G+2§!

d_the_zone.en_desc: A thirteen-by-thirteen kilometer stretch of land on this planet is a ruin of unknown origin, littered with many bizarre and unique alien artifacts. Bafflingly, it also produces sensations of deep contentment in its visitors.
d_the_zone.zhcn_planet_modifier: 来自£job£ 岗位的£physics_research£ 物理学研究：§G+15%§!

d_cryonic_clones.zhcn_desc: 当这个环形世界仍然是废墟的时候，有几百个外星克隆生物被封存在冷冻保存仓之中。现在这些被修复的冷冻仓成为了一所纪念碑。
d_cryonic_clones.en_desc: Hundreds of alien clones were left sealed in cryostasis chambers when this Ring World was still a ruin. Now fully restored, the clones have been preserved in this monument.

d_flooded_mounds.zhcn_desc: 在这个世界的深海底部可以发现上千个互相连接着的丘穴，如同巨大的白蚁群落所构建的一般。其实这里是远古智慧节肢动物所留下来的遗迹。
d_flooded_mounds.en_desc: Thousands upon thousands of interconnected termite-like mounds can be found far beneath the ocean on this world, the last remnants of an ancient species of sapient arthropoids.

d_processing_pens.en_desc: The fungoids native to this planet were genetically engineered to be docile... and delicious. In these vast processing pens, the fungoids are nourished and then harvested.

d_harvester_fields.zhcn_desc: 种满了可食用植物的广袤田地上，远古太阳能收割机被用于帮助收割。

d_harvester_fields.zhcn_planet_modifier: 农业区划最大建造数量：§G+6§!

d_worm_farm.zhcn_desc: 种植的农作物在风中摇曳。

d_worm_farm.zhcn_planet_modifier: 农业区划最大建造数量：§G+4§!

d_organic_landfill.zhcn_desc: 有毒的化学废料在烈日的暴晒下腐败并散发着薄烟。
d_organic_landfill.en_desc: Toxic biohazard waste rots and fumes in vast heaps under the sun.

d_underground_mine.zhcn_planet_modifier: 采矿区划最大建造数量：§G+3§!\n最大区划数：§G+2§!

d_ancient_one.en_desc: An ancient being, living deep beneath the waves, is the dominating life force on this planet.

d_numas_breath.zhcn_desc: 这座深入星球地壳的稳定裂口是由拜金教团制造的。
d_numas_breath.en_desc: This stable vent reaching into the planet's crust was created by The Numistic Order.

d_nanosands.en_desc: The sand dunes on this planet are almost entirely composed of countless broken nanites. Their structure is degraded far beyond any chance for reactivation, but they do coat the planet in rare metal granulate.
d_nanosands.zhcn_planet_modifier: 采矿区划最大建造数量：§G+2§!\n最大区划数：§G+2§!

d_dragon_monument.zhcn_desc: 一座纪念击败以太巨龙的伟大纪念碑。
d_dragon_monument.en_desc: A monument commemorating the defeat of the Ether Drake.

d_stellarite_trophy.zhcn_desc: 一个由噬星者的残骸拼凑成的战利品，以纪念帝国面对这个巨兽取得的伟大胜利。
d_stellarite_trophy.en_desc: A trophy made out of the remains of the Stellar Devourer, reminding our great nation of its victory over the gargantuan entity.

d_scandinavian_reclamation_sector.zhcn_desc: 22世纪末进行的大型恢复再开发行动十分有效，除了几处最为顽固的放射区域以外，其它区域都已经恢复了正常。核泄漏事件以来的基因突变率已降至最低点。
d_scandinavian_reclamation_sector.en_desc: Reclamation efforts in the late 22nd century eliminated all but the most stubborn pockets of radiation, and mutation levels are now at an all-time low since the Containment Breach.
d_scandinavian_reclamation_sector.zhcn_planet_modifier: 农业区划最大建造数量：§G+1§!

d_pacific_algae_tracts.zhcn_desc: 只有潜到海底才能看到的壮观景象。好似能一直蔓延下去，没有尽头。
d_pacific_algae_tracts.en_desc: Invisible until you plunge beneath the waves, the algae tracts seem to stretch into infinity.
d_pacific_algae_tracts.zhcn_planet_modifier: 农业区划最大建造数量：§G+3§!

d_saharan_irrigation_project.zhcn_desc: 当年绿色撒哈拉行动刚刚被提出时，伊兹奎多教授受到了各界的冷嘲热讽……但现在应该已经没人记得了吧。
d_saharan_irrigation_project.en_desc: Few today remember the vicious ridicule that Operation Green Sahara faced when it was first proposed by Professor Izquierdo.
d_saharan_irrigation_project.zhcn_planet_modifier: 农业区划最大建造数量：§G+4§!

d_mesopotamian_urban_corridor.zhcn_name: 美索不达米亚城市走廊
d_mesopotamian_urban_corridor.zhcn_desc: 几乎遍及整个新月沃地的这个巨大都市，其本身就是对文明发源之地的致敬。
d_mesopotamian_urban_corridor.en_desc: The megalopolis that stretches along most of the Fertile Crescent is in itself a monument to this ancient birthplace of civilization.
d_mesopotamian_urban_corridor.zhcn_planet_modifier: 采矿区划最大建造数量：§G+3§!

d_delhi_sprawl.zhcn_desc: 直到22世纪末，吉祥天商业高塔一直是地球上最高的建筑。其特殊的造型直到现在都是德里城区一道独特的风景。
d_delhi_sprawl.en_desc: Lakshmi Commerce Tower was the tallest building on Earth for the better part of the 22nd century, and its unique shape remains an iconic feature of the Delhi skyline.
d_delhi_sprawl.zhcn_planet_modifier: 发电区划最大建造数量：§G+2§!

d_boswash_metropolitan_axis.zhcn_name: 波士顿-华盛顿都市枢纽
d_boswash_metropolitan_axis.zhcn_desc: 波士顿-华盛顿暴动给整整一代人留下了难以抚平的创伤。也正是因为如此，才引致了大刀阔斧的法律改革。永远不要忘记前人的牺牲！
d_boswash_metropolitan_axis.en_desc: The BosWash Riots traumatized an entire generation and led to sweeping legal reforms. Never Forget!
d_boswash_metropolitan_axis.zhcn_planet_modifier: 发电区划最大建造数量：§G+3§!

d_pearl_river_agglomerate.zhcn_desc: 珠江区域是地球上第一个被正式归类为巨型都市的地区。在此处发扬光大的金三角防污染政策将会被世界各地的大型城市所相继运用。
d_pearl_river_agglomerate.en_desc: The first region on Earth to be officially designated a megacity. Several other developing urban regions would eventually adopt their own versions of the Golden Delta's successful anti-pollution policies.
d_pearl_river_agglomerate.zhcn_planet_modifier: 发电区划最大建造数量：§G+3§!

d_mauritanian_security_zone.zhcn_desc: 在这里，铁切尔上校和他余下寥寥的兵士们进行了他们世界闻名的背水一战。直到现在，也偶尔会在此处发现当年没有爆炸的哑弹。
d_mauritanian_security_zone.en_desc: Unexploded munitions are still occasionally found near the compound where Colonel Tetchu and the remnants of his brigade made their famous last stand.
d_mauritanian_security_zone.zhcn_planet_modifier: 采矿区划最大建造数量：§G+1§!

d_great_albertan_crater.zhcn_desc: 当萨蒂斯711494号迫近地球的消息传来时，造成了72年的大规模恐慌事件。每个人都认为地球大限已至——该来的最终还是来了。幸运的是，萨蒂斯711494号的体积并没有大到摧毁整个地球，但阿尔伯塔的大半部分还是不幸从地图上被抹去了。
d_great_albertan_crater.en_desc: When 711494 Satis approached Earth and triggered the Great Panic of '72, everyone thought this was it - the Big One had finally arrived. Fortunately, it wasn't big enough to cause an extinction event. Unfortunately, it wiped out much of Alberta.
d_great_albertan_crater.zhcn_planet_modifier: 采矿区划最大建造数量：§G+3§!

d_great_pacific_garbage_patch.zhcn_desc: 人类制造的大量塑料垃圾已经覆盖了太平洋的一大部分。
d_great_pacific_garbage_patch.en_desc: A swirling miasma of plastic refuse covers a good portion of Earth's largest ocean.

d_failing_infrastructure_earth.zhcn_desc: 这片区域充斥着大量废弃的工业建筑与含有剧毒的土壤，都是旧时代的遗物。
d_failing_infrastructure_earth.en_desc: This region is covered by ruined industrial complexes and toxic soil; detritus from a past age of progress.

d_collapsed_spire.zhcn_desc: 此区域中一座巨型居住用尖塔因其自身重量而坍塌，阻挡了进入的通路。在其仍屹立在地面上的时代，这座塔一定是行星上最为高大的构筑物之一。
d_collapsed_spire.en_desc: An immense residential spire has collapsed under its own weight in this region, blocking access. While it was still standing, this towering structure must have been among the tallest on the planet.

d_massive_crevice.zhcn_desc: 此区域曾经是一片人口稠密的城区，如今却被一道巨型裂隙一分为二。这里的地质结构极为不稳，时常发生地震和滑坡。
d_massive_crevice.en_desc: This region is divided by a vast crevice that cuts through what was once a dense urban zone. The ground here is extremely unstable, with frequent earthquakes and landslides.

d_shattered_solar_array.zhcn_desc: 这些破碎的残骸原本是某种庞大的太阳能阵列。在它仍能运转之时，其一定为行星上一片可观的区域提供了能源。
d_shattered_solar_array.en_desc: The shattered remnants of some kind of colossal solar array. When it was still functional, it must have provided power to a significant portion of this planet.

d_flooded_reactor_pits.zhcn_desc: 这些深邃的坑洞中曾经放置着行星主要的能量生产设施。千百万年过去，降雨和洪水已在坑洞中积满了泥浆。
d_flooded_reactor_pits.en_desc: These deep pits appear to have once housed the planet's main energy production facilities. Over the eons, rain and flooding have filled the pits with murky water.

d_crumbling_mining_tunnels.zhcn_desc: 行星地表下错综交织的矿道网络似乎曾经是此星球矿物的主要来源。千百年来的岩崩和塌方使得这些坑道仅剩一小部分可供通行。
d_crumbling_mining_tunnels.en_desc: A network of deep tunnels beneath the planet's surface seem to have been its primary source of minerals. Millennia of cave-ins and rockfalls have left only a fraction of the tunnels traversable.

d_ancient_reactor_pits.zhcn_desc: 这些靠近行星赤道的深邃坑洞中曾经放置着此星球主要的能量发生器。令人啧啧称奇的是其基础设施极为坚固，至今尚可使用，我们可以向其中放入新的反应堆。
d_ancient_reactor_pits.en_desc: These deep pits near the planet's equator once housed its primary energy generators. Much of the surprisingly sturdy infrastructure has survived, and new reactors can be slotted into it.
d_ancient_reactor_pits.zhcn_planet_modifier: 发电区划最大建造数量：§G+6§!

d_immense_solar_array.zhcn_desc: 这个太阳能阵列的大小几乎接近一小块大陆。阵列的大部分已经破碎，无法修复，但其下层的能源基础设施仍可使用，使之适于作为能源生产的基址。
d_immense_solar_array.en_desc: This solar array is nearly the size of a small continent. Most of it has been smashed beyond repair, but the underlying power infrastructure has survived, making it a good site for energy production.
d_immense_solar_array.zhcn_planet_modifier: 发电区划最大建造数量：§G+3§!

d_abandoned_mining_tunnels.zhcn_desc: 从这些坑道中运出的矿物建造了行星表面上的许多遗迹。尽管大多已被开采殆尽，仍剩一些矿道可以提供丰厚的产出。
d_abandoned_mining_tunnels.en_desc: Many of the ruins on the planet's surface were built by minerals extracted from these tunnels. Although most have been mined to depletion, there are still several with rich yields.
d_abandoned_mining_tunnels.zhcn_planet_modifier: 采矿区划最大建造数量：§G+6§!

d_relic_metal_boneyard.zhcn_desc: 坍塌的建筑只剩下一副空空如也的金属架子，当风掠过，这空架子似乎发出了悲鸣声。
d_relic_metal_boneyard.en_desc: The hollowed-out metal skeletons of fallen infrastructure seem almost to groan as the wind whistles through them.
d_relic_metal_boneyard.zhcn_planet_modifier: 采矿区划最大建造数量：§G+3§!

d_central_spire.zhcn_desc: 这一塔状结构曾经作为行星的管理中心。其位于中央的位置和近乎无损的内部结构为研究星球上的遗迹提供了无与伦比的机会。
d_central_spire.en_desc: This towering structure appears to have served as the administrative center of the planet. Its central location and mostly intact interior provides an unmatched opportunity to research the ruins of this world.
d_central_spire.zhcn_planet_modifier: 来自£job£ 岗位的£society_research£ 社会学研究：§G+15%§!\n来自£job£ 岗位的£engineering_research£ 工程学研究：§G+15%§!\n来自£job£ 岗位的£physics_research£ 物理学研究：§G+15%§!

d_industrial_sector.zhcn_desc: 此地区整体曾作为行星工业生产的核心区域。这里的制造厂和精炼厂早已停止运转，但在区域中仍可找到大量散置的资源。
d_industrial_sector.en_desc: This entire region once served as the industrial heartland of the planet. The factories and refineries that operated here have long since stopped working, but vast amounts of scattered resources can still be found in the area.
d_industrial_sector.zhcn_planet_modifier: 水晶矿井最大建造数量：§G+2§!\n气体采集井最大建造数量：§G+2§!\n微粒捕获阱最大建造数量：§G+2§!

d_relic_dense_ruins.zhcn_desc: 研究遗落星球地表覆盖的大量废墟能够助益科学研究，但它们的存在也将会限制可居住空间。
d_relic_dense_ruins.en_desc: The study of the dense ruins that cover this Relic World are a boon to science, but their presence also limits the amount of livable space.
d_relic_dense_ruins.zhcn_planet_modifier:
最大区划数：§R-6§!
来自£job£ 岗位的£society_research£ 社会学研究：§G+15%§!
来自£job£ 岗位的£engineering_research£ 工程学研究：§G+15%§!
来自£job£ 岗位的£physics_research£ 物理学研究：§G+15%§!

d_former_relic_world.zhcn_desc: 此都市星球原本是一个遭人废弃的遗落星球。旧有的废墟大多已在世界型都市重建时被重新规划或清理干净，但这里仍有许多具有科学价值的场所。
d_former_relic_world.en_desc: This ecumenopolis was once an abandoned Relic World. Most of the old ruins were repurposed or cleared away when the planet-wide city was rebuilt, but there are still many sites that are of scientific value.
d_former_relic_world.zhcn_planet_modifier: 来自£job£ 岗位的£society_research£ 社会学研究：§G+10%§!\n来自£job£ 岗位的£engineering_research£ 工程学研究：§G+10%§!\n来自£job£ 岗位的£physics_research£ 物理学研究：§G+10%§!

d_mutation_vats.zhcn_desc: 在这一痛苦的仪式过程中，这个核交换后的社会的成员会把自身暴露在接近致命剂量的化学诱变剂下，希望能揭示出他们的“真实自我”。在许多培养仓底部发现的骨骼残骸表明，只有一部分祈祷者能幸存下来。
d_mutation_vats.en_desc: In a painful ceremonial procedure, members of this post-nuclear exchange society on this planet would expose themselves to near-lethal doses of chemical mutagens, in the hopes of revealing their 'true selves.' The skeletal remains found at the bottom of many of these vats suggest not all supplicants survived the ordeal.
